meanings.sent1: She whitewashed the fence to make it look clean.
meanings.sent2: The old house was whitewashed to give it a fresh appearance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids whitewashed the sidewalk for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her smile whitewashed any worries from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush whitewashed the canvas with delicate strokes.

meanings.definition: To make something appear better or more acceptable than it really is.
meanings.sent1: He always whitewashed his mistakes to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent2: The company tried to whitewash their financial problems in the report.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes whitewashed the awkward situation.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses couldn't whitewash the truth of the matter.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech tried to whitewash his controversial actions.
